### dupRetToEnableTailCallOpts() {#a29a32e999bef6e6fd8876e11332fc8a8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::dupRetToEnableTailCallOpts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42; BB, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-codegenprepare-cpp-/#af5758ce8e1ea07d0c154e97556db4379">ModifyDT</a> &amp; ModifiedDT)</>}>
Look for opportunities to duplicate return instructions to the predecessor to enable tail call optimizations.

The case it is currently looking for is the following one. Known intrinsics or library function that may be tail called are taken into account as well. 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb0:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %tmp0 = tail call i32 @f0()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br label %return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %tmp1 = tail call i32 @f1()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br label %return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %tmp2 = tail call i32 @f2()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br label %return</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">return:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %retval = phi i32 &#91; %tmp0, %bb0 &#93;, &#91; %tmp1, %bb1 &#93;, &#91; %tmp2, %bb2 &#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ret i32 %retval</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

=&gt;


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb0:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %tmp0 = tail call i32 @f0()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ret i32 %tmp0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %tmp1 = tail call i32 @f1()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ret i32 %tmp1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %tmp2 = tail call i32 @f2()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ret i32 %tmp2</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l00446">446</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### optimizeExt() {#a6df2c21c695e9f4b2daffadc78315161}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::optimizeExt (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;&amp; Inst)</>}>
Move a zext or sext fed by a load into the same basic block as the load, unless conditions are unfavorable.

This allows <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> to fold the extend into the load.

E.g., 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    %ld = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpumarklastscratchload-cpp/#a8a3fe89940744b94ffe5dacd6704c2be">load</a> i32&#42; %addr</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cdae6bcee28992dab735eaa43f5dfa48a09">add</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cdae6bcee28992dab735eaa43f5dfa48a09">add</a> nuw i32 %ld, 4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    %zext = zext i32 %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-am/#a5d0557608eaebed12bc00812724ba2cdae6bcee28992dab735eaa43f5dfa48a09">add</a> to i64</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// </Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> =&gt; 
<ProgramListing>

### optimizeGatherScatterInst() {#ae01c9a10c8ff78ab53ad052a3ba0da3d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::optimizeGatherScatterInst (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; MemoryInst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; Ptr)</>}>
Rewrite GEP input to gather/scatter to enable <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondagbuilder">SelectionDAGBuilder</a> to find a uniform base to use for ISD::MGATHER/MSCATTER.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondagbuilder">SelectionDAGBuilder</a> can only handle a 2 operand GEP in the same basic block or a splat constant vector. The 2 operands to the GEP must have a scalar pointer and a vector index.

If the existing GEP has a vector base pointer that is splat, we can look through the splat to find the scalar pointer. If we can&#39;t find a scalar pointer there&#39;s nothing we can do.

If we have a GEP with more than 2 indices where the middle indices are all zeroes, we can replace it with 2 GEPs where the second has 2 operands.

If the final index isn&#39;t a vector or is a splat, we can emit a scalar GEP followed by a GEP with an all zeroes vector index. This will enable <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondagbuilder">SelectionDAGBuilder</a> to use the scalar GEP as the uniform base and have a zero index.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l00432">432</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### optimizeLoadExt() {#a391adeee5b39aa16cf62049001ca645f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::optimizeLoadExt (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42; Load)</>}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l00437">437</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.

### optimizeMemoryInst() {#afd8b9969b84a5af5e0cb3bfb01396efe}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::optimizeMemoryInst (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; MemoryInst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; Addr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; AccessTy, unsigned AddrSpace)</>}>
Sink addressing mode computation immediate before MemoryInst if doing so can be done without increasing register pressure.

The need for the register pressure constraint means this can end up being an all or nothing decision for all uses of the same addressing computation.

Load and Store Instructions often have addressing modes that can do significant amounts of computation. As such, instruction selection will try to get the load or store to do as much computation as possible for the program. The problem is that isel can only see within a single block. As such, we sink as much legal addressing mode work into the block as possible.

This method is used to optimize both load/store and inline asms with memory operands. It&#39;s also used to sink addressing computations feeding into cold call sites into their (cold) basic block.

The motivation for handling sinking into cold blocks is that doing so can both enable other address mode sinking (by satisfying the register pressure constraint above), and reduce register pressure globally (by removing the addressing mode computation from the fast path entirely.).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l00430">430</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### splitBranchCondition() {#a012eb45f151fde970456d622d79becef}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::splitBranchCondition (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-codegenprepare-cpp-/#af5758ce8e1ea07d0c154e97556db4379">ModifyDT</a> &amp; ModifiedDT)</>}>
Some targets prefer to split a conditional branch like:

<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%0 = icmp ne i32 %a, 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%1 = icmp ne i32 %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea92eb5ffee6ae2fec3ad71c777531578f">b</a>, 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">%or.cond = or i1 %0, %1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">br i1 %or.cond, label %TrueBB, label %FalseBB</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> into multiple branch instructions like: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb1:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %0 = icmp ne i32 %a, 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br i1 %0, label %TrueBB, label %bb2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">bb2:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  %1 = icmp ne i32 %<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea92eb5ffee6ae2fec3ad71c777531578f">b</a>, 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  br i1 %1, label %TrueBB, label %FalseBB</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> This usually allows instruction selection to do even further optimizations and combine the compare with the branch instruction. Currently this is applied for targets which have &quot;cheap&quot; jump instructions.

FIXME: Remove the (equivalent?) implementation in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a>.

### tryToPromoteExts() {#a9a02e3d0ad1ea144575f64ba9a95634e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CodeGenPrepare::tryToPromoteExts (<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-codegenprepare-cpp-/typepromotiontransaction">TypePromotionTransaction</a> &amp; TPT, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; Exts, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; ProfitablyMovedExts, unsigned CreatedInstsCost=0)</>}>
Try to speculatively promote extensions in <code>Exts</code> and continue promoting through newly promoted operands recursively as far as doing so is profitable.

Save extensions profitably moved up, in <code>ProfitablyMovedExts</code>. When some promotion happened, <code>TPT</code> contains the proper state to revert them.

true if some promotion happened, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>

### SunkAddrs {#a3bb34eab6528acd9f39f7f4d60170140}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ValueMap&lt;Value &#42;, WeakTrackingVH&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;CodeGenPrepare.cpp&#125;::CodeGenPrepare::SunkAddrs</>}>
Keeps track of non-local addresses that have been sunk into a block.

This allows us to avoid inserting duplicate code for blocks with multiple load/stores of the same address. The usage of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh">WeakTrackingVH</a> enables SunkAddrs to be treated as a cache whose entries can be invalidated if a sunken address computation has been erased.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp/#l00328">328</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/codegenprepare-cpp">CodeGenPrepare.cpp</a>.
